intro: Sopubia kituiensis, commonly known as the Kitui sopa, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Sopubia kituiensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
